body_content.explanation: (of a tree) having more than one branch:
examples: Heavy ice accumulation on a multi-branched trunk may even cause a tree to split in two.

body_content.explanation: having one central part that divides into separate parts :
examples: The plant has bright yellow blooms on multi-branched stems.
The table is covered in a crisp white cloth and is lit by two multi-branched candelabra.

body_content.explanation: (of an organization, etc.) having offices, buildings, etc. in several places, or having different departments or divisions :
examples: The museums are run by the multibranched Ministry of National Heritage.
